entry.def: Sunglasses are glasses with dark lenses which you wear to protect your eyes from bright sunlight.

example.ex: She slipped on a pair of sunglasses.
example.tran: 她迅速戴上一副太阳镜。

means.word_mean: 1. spectacles that are darkened or polarized to protect the eyes from the glare of the sun;

sentences.sentence: "he was wearing a pair of mirrored shades"

auth_sentence.content: Music to wear sunglasses to never sounded so good.
auth_sentence.res_content: Music to wear sunglasses to never sounded so good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Music to wear sunglasses to never sounded so good.

auth_sentence.content: I thought, 'Wow, making sunglasses in Italy!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I thought, 'Wow, making sunglasses in Italy!

auth_sentence.content: I thought I could see myself behind those sunglasses.
auth_sentence.res_content: I thought I could see myself behind those sunglasses.

sentences.en: He was wearing very with-it sunglasses.
sentences.cn: 他戴着非常时髦的太阳镜。

sentences.en: Her eyes were masked by huge round sunglasses.
sentences.cn: 她的双眼被一副圆形大墨镜遮住了。

sentences.en: Her sunglasses had fallen into the pond.
sentences.cn: 她的太阳镜掉进池塘了。

sentences.en: It’s been raining all week and sunglasses are a real drug on the market.
sentences.cn: 整整下了一周的雨,太阳镜真的成了滞销品。

sentences.en: There were some cool dudes in sunglasses standing about.
sentences.cn: 有一些戴着太阳镜、服装华丽的城里人站在四周。
